entry.title: Neural fields and power spectra
entry.summary:
Contents

  • Overview
  • Notebook Setup
  • Theory
  • Toy examples
    • 1D neural fields
    • 2D neural fields
  • TVB simulations
    • Isolated nodes
    • Whole-brain network, region-level simulations (heterogeneous global connectivity)
    • Whole-brain network, surface-level simulations (heterogenous global + homogenous local connectivity)

post format: as-you-go

Overview¶

Ever since their inception in the late 1950s, neural mass and neural field models have been used to study oscillations and power spectra, from a wide array of experimental preparations. including LFPs, EEG, MEG, ECoG, fMRI in humans, monkeys, rabbits, mice, in-vivo, ex-vivo; you name it.

Here I want to take a closer look at the human M/EEG power spectrum.

The two principal properties of the power spectrum are

  1. the presence of spectral peaks (primarily in the alpha range; but also to a lesser extent in beta, theta, delta, and gamma frequencies also;

  2. 1/f profile

Very broadly, the spectral peaks are generally considered (at least in the modelling literature) to be due to local and/or global resonance effects in the dynamics of neural population activity.

There are a variety of more specific theories and proposals on the details of these; I don't want to go into that too much here.

Rather, here I want to take a look at the 1/f properties of the power spectra.

A theoretical account of this was offered in Jirsa 2008. The idea discussed there is that the 1/f pattern is due to the spatiotemporal 'filtering' effects of local neural fields.

The following notes explore this idea theoretically and with numerical simulations. In particular, we want to go beyond the toy-ish 1D simulations in Jirsa 2008, study these effects in whole-brain surface-based simulations with TVB.

Notebook Setup¶

Define some variables

# put some system-specific variables in the namespace ('le' dict)
%run ~/set_localenv_vars.py

nb_name = 'neural_fields_and_power_spectra'

# this is where I look for stuf
outdir = '%s/notebooks/%s' %(le['data_dir'],nb_name)

# this is where stuff actually lives
outdir_loc = '%s/%s' %('/mnt/titania-hecuba/mcintosh_lab/john/Data/notebooks', nb_name)
#outdir_loc = '%s/%s' %('/hecuba/mcintosh_lab/john/Data/notebooks', nb_name)

# symlink the two
import os
if not os.path.isdir(outdir_loc): os.makedirs(outdir_loc)
if not os.path.isdir(outdir): os.system('ln -s %s %s' %(outdir_loc,outdir))
                                        

# root path to tvb-library, tvb-data, etc. libraries. 
tvb_folder = le['code_dir'] + '/libraries_of_mine/github'


# stuff for workdocs-cloudfiles

aws_key = 'drowssaperucesyreva'
aws_secret = '?teytidettopsuoyevah'

Importage

# Generic imports

import os,sys,glob,h5py,itertools,multiprocessing,\
       numpy as np,pandas as pd
from datetime import datetime
from time import time
from scipy import optimize
from scipy.spatial import cKDTree

# Visualization stuff

%matplotlib inline
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
from IPython.display import Image,display as d,IFrame
import seaborn as sns


# Analysis stuff

import nibabel as nib
from nilearn.plotting import plot_roi
from dipy.tracking.utils import apply_affine
from nitime import TimeSeries
from nitime.analysis import SpectralAnalyzer

import powerlaw

from sympy import E, Eq, Function, pde_separate_add, Derivative as D
from sympy.abc import x, t 
from sympy.solvers.pde import pdsolve
from sympy import Function, diff, pprint, exp
from sympy.abc import x,y
from sympy import Abs
from sympy.integrals.integrals import Integral
from sympy.abc import psi,epsilon,x,t,D,gamma,W,S,y,v
from sympy import Equality
from sympy import pde_separate,pde
from sympy import pde_separate,pde_separate_add
from sympy import init_printing
init_printing()


# TVB stuff

nbso,nbse = sys.stdout,sys.stderr # hack part 1/2 to keep output printing properly
sys.path.append(tvb_folder +'/tvb-library')
sys.path.append(tvb_folder + '/tvb-data')
from tvb.simulator.lab import *
sys.stdout,sys.stderr = nbso,nbse  # ...hack part 2/2
from tvb.simulator.plot.tools import plot_surface_mpl,plot_surface_mpl_mv
from tvb.datatypes.cortex import Cortex
from tvb.datatypes.region_mapping import RegionMapping

from copy import copy # seems that this needs to be done last otherwise it gets 
                      # replaced with numpy copy function
    
    
# aws api and workdocs-cloudfiles stuff

sys.path.append(le['ipynb_workdocs_dir'])
from new_utils import nb_fig,cloudfiles_nb

Define some functions

def compute_nitime_ps(dat,roi_names,sampling_interval):
    
  # note - time unit is seconds
  # dat is a rectangular matrix; rois x time
  T = TimeSeries(dat, sampling_interval=sampling_interval)
  T.metadata['roi'] = roi_names
  S = SpectralAnalyzer(T)

  df_fs = pd.DataFrame(np.abs(S.spectrum_fourier[1]),
                     columns=S.spectrum_fourier[0]).T
  df_fs.columns.names = ['roi']
  df_fs.index.names = ['freq']    

  df_mts = pd.DataFrame(np.abs(S.spectrum_multi_taper[1]),
                     columns=S.spectrum_multi_taper[0]).T
  df_mts.columns.names = ['roi']
  df_mts.index.names = ['freq']    
    

  return df_fs,df_mts,S

Initialize aws api and workdocs-cloudfiles folder

cnb = cloudfiles_nb('aws', [aws_key,aws_secret])
cnb.initialize_folder(nb_name)

Calico document extensions

%%javascript
IPython.load_extensions('calico-spell-check', 
                        'calico-document-tools', 'calico-cell-tools');

Go to output folder

os.chdir(outdir)

Ok, let's get cracking.

Theory¶

(coming soon...)

(c.f. Jirsa 2008 etc.)

1D neural fields¶

TVB simulations¶

Isolated nodes¶

Spiegler 2016 params (roughly). This reduce the 2D oscillator to a classic FHN model, with a natural frequency in the gamma range.

# Specify model and run isolated node
# -----------------------------------

dt = 0.1 # 2**-4# 0.1
n_step=5000

# spiegler params
gamma_sp = 0.01 # just under critical point (note is converted to minus below) #1.21
epsilon_sp =  12.3083
eta_sp = (1/1000.) * 76.74   

params = dict(d = eta_sp,  tau = 1.,f = 1.,
              e = 0., g = -gamma_sp,alpha = 1., 
              gamma = 1., c = 0., b= -epsilon_sp,
              beta = 0,  a = 0.)

mod = models.Generic2dOscillator(**params)
time,dat = mod.stationary_trajectory(n_step=n_step,dt=dt)

# Put sim results into a pandas dataframe
V_dat = np.squeeze(dat[:,0,:,:])
W_dat = np.squeeze(dat[:,1,:,:])
df_VW = pd.DataFrame([V_dat,W_dat],
                     index=['V', 'W'], 
                     columns=time).T

# Compute power spectrum
# ----------------------
sampling_interval= np.unique(np.diff(time))[0] / 1000.
df_fs,df_mts,S = compute_nitime_ps(df_VW['V'].values[:,np.newaxis].T,
                                   df_VW.index[:,np.newaxis],
                                   sampling_interval)

# <!--collapse=True-->

# Plot and embed in LN
# --------------------

figf = outdir + '/pics/isolated_node_spiegler2016_params.png'


fig, ax = plt.subplots(ncols=4, figsize=(12,3))

# V and W vs. time
df_VW.plot(ax=ax[0])

# V vs. W trajectory
ymax = df_VW.W.max() + df_VW.W.std()*1.5
ymin = df_VW.W.min() - df_VW.W.std()*1.5
xmax = df_VW.V.max() + df_VW.V.std()*1.5
xmin = df_VW.V.min() - df_VW.V.std()*1.5
df_VW.plot(x='V', y='W', legend=False,ax=ax[1],
           xlim=[xmin,xmax],ylim=[ymin,ymax],alpha=0.5)

# power spectrum

df_fs.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True, linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[2],c='b')           
df_mts.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='r') 

df_fs.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[3],c='b')           
df_mts.ix[:100].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[3],c='r')


plt.savefig(figf, bbox_inches='tight')
plt.close()


# Embed in LN
cap = ''; label = 'Isolated node phase plane dynamics; Spiegler2016 params'
im = nb_fig(figf,label,cap,cnb,show_fignum=False,size=(800,500))
d(im)
Isolated node phase plane dynamics; Spiegler2016 params.

TVB 'building a brain network model' demo params - alpha + several other peaks

# Specify model and run isolated node
# -----------------------------------

dt = 0.1 # 2**-4# 0.1
n_step=20000

params = dict(a = 1.05,b = -1.,c = 0.,d = 0.1,e = 0.,
                   f = 0.3333,g = 1.,I = 0.,alpha = 1.,beta = 0.2,
                   gamma = -1.,tau = 1.25)

# increase background excitability
params['I'] = 2.

mod = models.Generic2dOscillator(**params)
time,dat = mod.stationary_trajectory(n_step=n_step,dt=dt)

# Put sim results into a pandas dataframe
V_dat = np.squeeze(dat[:,0,:,:])
W_dat = np.squeeze(dat[:,1,:,:])
df_VW = pd.DataFrame([V_dat,W_dat],
                     index=['V', 'W'], 
                     columns=time).T

# Compute power spectrum
# ----------------------
sampling_interval= np.unique(np.diff(time))[0] / 1000.
df_fs,df_mts,S = compute_nitime_ps(df_VW['V'].values[:,np.newaxis].T,
                                   df_VW.index[:,np.newaxis],
                                   sampling_interval)

# <!--collapse=True-->

# Plot and embed in LN
# --------------------

figf = outdir + '/pics/isolated_node_babnmdemo_params.png'


fig, ax = plt.subplots(ncols=4, figsize=(12,3))

# V and W vs. time
df_VW.plot(ax=ax[0])

# V vs. W trajectory
ymax = df_VW.W.max() + df_VW.W.std()*1.5
ymin = df_VW.W.min() - df_VW.W.std()*1.5
xmax = df_VW.V.max() + df_VW.V.std()*1.5
xmin = df_VW.V.min() - df_VW.V.std()*1.5
df_VW.plot(x='V', y='W', legend=False,ax=ax[1],
           xlim=[xmin,xmax],ylim=[ymin,ymax],alpha=0.5)

# power spectrum

df_fs.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True, linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[2],c='b')           
df_mts.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='r') 

df_fs.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[3],c='b')           
df_mts.ix[:100].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[3],c='r')


plt.savefig(figf, bbox_inches='tight')
plt.close()


# Embed in LN
cap = ''; label = 'Isolated node phase plane dynamics; TVB BABNM demo params'
im = nb_fig(figf,label,cap,cnb,show_fignum=False,size=(800,500))
d(im)
Isolated node phase plane dynamics; TVB BABNM demo params.

A few changes to spiegler params gets a clean-ish alpha peak

# Specify model and run isolated node
# -----------------------------------

dt = 0.1 # 2**-4# 0.1
n_step=20000

gamma_sp = 0. #1.21
epsilon_sp =  1. #10.#12.3083
eta_sp = (1/1000.) * 76.74 
params = dict(d = eta_sp,tau = 1.,f = 1.,e = 0., g = -gamma_sp,
              alpha = 1., gamma = 1., c = 0.,b= -epsilon_sp, 
              beta = 0, a = 0.,I=2.0)

mod = models.Generic2dOscillator(**params)
time,dat = mod.stationary_trajectory(n_step=n_step,dt=dt)

# Put sim results into a pandas dataframe
V_dat = np.squeeze(dat[:,0,:,:])
W_dat = np.squeeze(dat[:,1,:,:])
df_VW = pd.DataFrame([V_dat,W_dat],
                     index=['V', 'W'], 
                     columns=time).T

# Compute power spectrum
# ----------------------
sampling_interval= np.unique(np.diff(time))[0] / 1000.
df_fs,df_mts,S = compute_nitime_ps(df_VW['V'].values[:,np.newaxis].T,
                                   df_VW.index[:,np.newaxis],
                                   sampling_interval)

# <!--collapse=True-->

# Plot and embed in LN
# --------------------

figf = outdir + '/pics/isolated_node_modifiedSpiegler2016_params.png'


fig, ax = plt.subplots(ncols=4, figsize=(12,3))

# V and W vs. time
df_VW.plot(ax=ax[0])

# V vs. W trajectory
ymax = df_VW.W.max() + df_VW.W.std()*1.5
ymin = df_VW.W.min() - df_VW.W.std()*1.5
xmax = df_VW.V.max() + df_VW.V.std()*1.5
xmin = df_VW.V.min() - df_VW.V.std()*1.5
df_VW.plot(x='V', y='W', legend=False,ax=ax[1],
           xlim=[xmin,xmax],ylim=[ymin,ymax],alpha=0.5)

# power spectrum

df_fs.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True, linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[2],c='b')           
df_mts.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='r')

df_mts.ix[:100].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[3],c='r')


plt.savefig(figf, bbox_inches='tight')
plt.close()


# Embed in LN
cap = ''; label = 'Isolated node phase plane dynamics; modified Spiegler 2016 params'
im = nb_fig(figf,label,cap,cnb,show_fignum=False,size=(800,500))
d(im)
Isolated node phase plane dynamics; modified Spiegler 2016 params.

Whole-brain network, region-level simulations (heterogeneous global connectivity)¶

Define a simple region-level simulation runner function

def run_sim(params,
            sim_len = 2e3,dt = 0.1,
            tau = 2,lca=0.01,
            tavg_per = 1.0):

  conn = connectivity.Connectivity(load_default=True)
    
  model = models.Generic2dOscillator(**params)
  cpl=coupling.Linear(a=lca)
  solver=integrators.HeunDeterministic(dt=dt)
  mons=(monitors.TemporalAverage(period=tavg_per),)
    
  sim = simulator.Simulator(model = model,connectivity=conn,coupling=cpl,
                            integrator=solver, 
                            monitors=mons)
  sim.configure()

  (tavg_time, tavg_data),  = sim.run(simulation_length=sim_len) 
    
  df_tavg = pd.DataFrame(np.squeeze(tavg_data),index=tavg_time)
  df_tavg.index.names = ['t']
  df_tavg.columns.names= ['node']
  df_tavg.columns = conn.region_labels    
    
  return df_tavg

Whole-brain simulation using the parameters identified above that give a clean alpha peak

# Specify model and run sim
# --------------------------

gamma_sp = 0. #1.21
epsilon_sp =  1. #10.#12.3083
eta_sp = (1/1000.) * 76.74    #eta_sp = 76.74 # 1. # 76.74 ##1. # 76.74 # 1.
params = dict(d = eta_sp,tau = 1.,f = 1.,e = 0., g = -gamma_sp,
              alpha = 1., gamma = 1., c = 0.,b= -epsilon_sp,
              beta = 0, a = 0.,I=2.0)

df_tavg = run_sim(params)


# Compute power spectrum
# ---------------------------------------
sampling_interval= np.unique(np.diff(df_tavg.index.values))[0] / 1000.
df_fs,df_mts,S = compute_nitime_ps(df_tavg.values.T,
                                   df_tavg.index[:,np.newaxis],
                                   sampling_interval)

# <!--collapse=True-->

# Plot and embed in LN
# --------------------

figf = outdir + '/pics/region_sim_alphapeak.png'


fig, ax = plt.subplots(ncols=3, figsize=(12,3))


df_tavg.plot(ax=ax[0], legend=False,alpha=0.8)

df_fs.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True, linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[1],c='b')           
df_mts.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[1],c='r') 

df_fs.ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[2],c='b')           
df_mts.ix[:100].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='r')


plt.savefig(figf, bbox_inches='tight')
plt.close()


# Embed in LN
cap = ''; label = 'Regional simulation, alpha peak-tuned params'
im = nb_fig(figf,label,cap,cnb,show_fignum=False,size=(800,500))
d(im)
Regional simulation, alpha peak-tuned params.

Whole-brain network, surface-level simulations (heterogenous global + homogenous local connectivity)¶

...so now add in full cortex; do surface simulation; how does that change this. Does it add in the line spectrum as in the paper?

def run_surf_sim(params,
            sim_len = 2e3,dt = 0.1,
            tau = 2,lca=0.01,
            tavg_per = 1.0,
            local_coupling_strength=np.array([2 ** -10])):
    
  conn = connectivity.Connectivity(load_default=True)
  model = models.Generic2dOscillator(**params)
  cpl=coupling.Linear(a=lca)
  solver=integrators.HeunDeterministic(dt=dt)
  mons=(monitors.TemporalAverage(period=tavg_per),)
    
  cortex_76 = Cortex(region_mapping_data=RegionMapping.from_file('regionMapping_16k_76.txt'),
                          load_default=True)
  cortex_76.coupling_strength = local_coupling_strength        
    
  sim = simulator.Simulator(model = model,connectivity=conn,coupling=cpl,
                            integrator=solver, 
                            monitors=mons,
                            surface=cortex_76)
  sim.configure()

  (tavg_time, tavg_data),  = sim.run(simulation_length=sim_len) 
    
  df_tavg = pd.DataFrame(np.squeeze(tavg_data),index=tavg_time)
  df_tavg.index.names = ['t']
  df_tavg.columns.names= ['node']
  #df_tavg.columns = conn.region_labels    
    
  return df_tavg

grab column numbers for a few vertices from a handful of nodes, for close scrutiny 

ctx = Cortex(region_mapping_data=RegionMapping.from_file('regionMapping_16k_76.txt'),
             load_default=True)
node10idx1to5 = np.nonzero(ctx.region_mapping==10)[0][:5]
node20idx1to5 = np.nonzero(ctx.region_mapping==20)[0][:5]
node30idx1to5 = np.nonzero(ctx.region_mapping==30)[0][:5]
node40idx1to5 = np.nonzero(ctx.region_mapping==40)[0][:5]
node50idx1to5 = np.nonzero(ctx.region_mapping==50)[0][:5]
node60idx1to5 = np.nonzero(ctx.region_mapping==60)[0][:5]


all_idx1to5s = np.concatenate([node10idx1to5,node20idx1to5,
                              node30idx1to5,node40idx1to5,
                              node50idx1to5,node60idx1to5])

# Specify model and run sim
# --------------------------

gamma_sp = 0. #1.21
epsilon_sp =  1. #10.#12.3083
eta_sp = (1/1000.) * 76.74    #eta_sp = 76.74 # 1. # 76.74 ##1. # 76.74 # 1.
params = dict(d = eta_sp,tau = 1.,f = 1.,e = 0., g = -gamma_sp,
              alpha = 1., gamma = 1., c = 0.,b= -epsilon_sp, 
              beta = 0, a = 0.,I=2.0)

df_tavg = run_surf_sim(params)
df_tavg_ss = df_tavg[all_idx1to5s]

# Compute power spectrum for a few nodes/vertices
# -----------------------------------------------
sampling_interval= np.unique(np.diff(df_tavg_ss.index.values))[0] / 1000.
df_fs,df_mts,S = compute_nitime_ps(df_tavg_ss.values.T,
                                   df_tavg_ss.index[:,np.newaxis],
                                   sampling_interval)
df_fs.columns = all_idx1to5s
df_mts.columns = all_idx1to5s

# <!--collapse=True-->

# Plot and embed in LN
# --------------------

figf = outdir + '/pics/surface_sim_alphapeak_params.png'


fig, ax = plt.subplots(ncols=3, figsize=(12,3))


df_tavg_ss[node10idx1to5].ix[500:].plot(ax=ax[0], legend=False,alpha=0.8,c='b',linewidth=0.1)
#df_fs[node10idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True, linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[1],c='b')           
df_mts[node10idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[1],c='b') 
#df_fs[node10idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[2],c='b')           
df_mts[node10idx1to5].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='b')


df_tavg_ss[node20idx1to5].ix[500:].plot(ax=ax[0], legend=False,alpha=0.8,c='r',linewidth=0.1)
df_mts[node20idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[1],c='r') 
df_mts[node20idx1to5].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='r')

df_tavg_ss[node30idx1to5].ix[500:].plot(ax=ax[0], legend=False,alpha=0.8,c='g',linewidth=0.1)
df_mts[node30idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[1],c='g') 
df_mts[node30idx1to5].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='g')

df_tavg_ss[node60idx1to5].ix[500:].plot(ax=ax[0], legend=False,alpha=0.8,c='k',linewidth=0.1)
df_mts[node60idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[1],c='k') 
df_mts[node60idx1to5].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='k')


plt.tight_layout()


plt.savefig(figf, bbox_inches='tight')
plt.close()

# Embed in LN
cap = ''; label = 'Surface-level simulation, alpha peak-tuned params'
im = nb_fig(figf,label,cap,cnb,show_fignum=False,size=(800,500))
d(im)
Surface-level simulation, alpha peak-tuned params.

fit power law exponent

# <!--collapse=True-->

figf = outdir + '/pics/surface_sim_alphapeak_params_plfits.png'


# Fit power law function
# --------------------



fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=1,ncols=6,figsize=(12,3))

nodes = [node10idx1to5[0],node20idx1to5[0],node30idx1to5[0],
         node40idx1to5[0],node50idx1to5[0],node60idx1to5[0]]
#nodes.remove(18)
#nodes.remove(19)

for node_it,node in enumerate(nodes):
    
  a = ax.ravel()[node_it]
    
  fit = powerlaw.Fit(df_fs[node].values,discrete=True)
  fit.distribution_compare('power_law', 'lognormal')
  fit.plot_ccdf(linewidth=3, label='Empirical Data',ax=a)
  fit.power_law.plot_ccdf(ax=a, color='r', linestyle='--', label='Power law fit')
  fit.lognormal.plot_ccdf(ax=a, color='g', linestyle='--', label='Lognormal fit')    
    
  a.set_xlim([0,df_fs.index.max()])
  a.set_ylim([10E-4,10E0])

    
plt.tight_layout()



plt.tight_layout()

plt.savefig(figf, bbox_inches='tight')
plt.close()

clear_output()


# Embed in LN
cap = ''; label = 'power law function fits for above sims'
im = nb_fig(figf,label,cap,cnb,show_fignum=False,size=(800,500))
d(im)
power law function fits for above sims.

higher local connectivity strength

# Specify model and run sim
# --------------------------

# ('lch' = local coupling high)
lc = np.array([2**-9])

gamma_sp = 0. #1.21
epsilon_sp =  1. #10.#12.3083
eta_sp = (1/1000.) * 76.74 
params = dict(d = eta_sp,tau = 1.,f = 1.,e = 0., g = -gamma_sp,
              alpha = 1., gamma = 1., c = 0.,b= -epsilon_sp, 
              beta = 0, a = 0.,I=2.0)

df_tavg_lch = run_surf_sim(params,local_coupling_strength=lc)
df_tavg_lch_ss = df_tavg_lch[all_idx1to5s]

# Compute power spectrum for a few nodes/vertices
# -----------------------------------------------
sampling_interval= np.unique(np.diff(df_tavg_lch_ss.index.values))[0] / 1000.
df_fs,df_mts,S = compute_nitime_ps(df_tavg_lch_ss.values.T,
                                   df_tavg_lch_ss.index[:,np.newaxis],
                                   sampling_interval)
df_fs.columns = all_idx1to5s
df_mts.columns = all_idx1to5s

# <!--collapse=True-->

# Plot and embed in LN
# --------------------

figf = outdir + '/pics/surface_sim_alphapeak_params_lch.png'


fig, ax = plt.subplots(ncols=3, figsize=(12,3))


df_tavg_lch_ss[node10idx1to5].ix[500:].plot(ax=ax[0], legend=False,alpha=0.8,c='b',linewidth=0.1)
#df_fs[node10idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True, linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[1],c='b')           
df_mts[node10idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[1],c='b') 
#df_fs[node10idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5, ax=ax[2],c='b')           
df_mts[node10idx1to5].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='b')


df_tavg_lch_ss[node20idx1to5].ix[500:].plot(ax=ax[0], legend=False,alpha=0.8,c='r',linewidth=0.1)
df_mts[node20idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[1],c='r') 
df_mts[node20idx1to5].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='r')

df_tavg_lch_ss[node30idx1to5].ix[500:].plot(ax=ax[0], legend=False,alpha=0.8,c='g',linewidth=0.1)
df_mts[node30idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[1],c='g') 
df_mts[node30idx1to5].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='g')

df_tavg_lch_ss[node60idx1to5].ix[500:].plot(ax=ax[0], legend=False,alpha=0.8,c='k',linewidth=0.1)
df_mts[node60idx1to5].ix[:100].plot(legend=False, logy=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[1],c='k') 
df_mts[node60idx1to5].plot(legend=False,logy=True,logx=True,linewidth=0.5,ax=ax[2],c='k')



plt.tight_layout()


plt.savefig(figf, bbox_inches='tight')
plt.close()

# Embed in LN
cap = ''; label = 'Surface-level simulation, alpha peak-tuned params; increased local connectivity strength'

Surface-level simulation, alpha peak-tuned params; increased local connectivity strength. 
# <!--collapse=True-->

figf = outdir + '/pics/surface_sim_alphapeak_params_lch_plfits.png'


# Fit power law function
# --------------------



fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=1,ncols=6,figsize=(12,3))

nodes = [node10idx1to5[0],node20idx1to5[0],node30idx1to5[0],
         node40idx1to5[0],node50idx1to5[0],node60idx1to5[0]]
#nodes.remove(18)
#nodes.remove(19)

for node_it,node in enumerate(nodes):
    
  a = ax.ravel()[node_it]
    
  fit = powerlaw.Fit(df_fs[node].values,discrete=True)
  fit.distribution_compare('power_law', 'lognormal')
  fit.plot_ccdf(linewidth=3, label='Empirical Data',ax=a)
  fit.power_law.plot_ccdf(ax=a, color='r', linestyle='--', label='Power law fit')
  fit.lognormal.plot_ccdf(ax=a, color='g', linestyle='--', label='Lognormal fit')    
    
  a.set_xlim([0,df_fs.index.max()])
  a.set_ylim([10E-4,10E0])

    
plt.tight_layout()


plt.tight_layout()

plt.savefig(figf, bbox_inches='tight')
plt.close()

clear_output()


# Embed in LN
cap = ''; label = 'power law function fits for above sims'
im = nb_fig(figf,label,cap,cnb,show_fignum=False,size=(800,500))
d(im)
power law function fits for above sims.
